inn1.comm: Noor Ali is off the mark with a little nudge off his hip, down to fine leg.
Rip-snorter! Jongwe bends his back and this delivery lifts menacingly past Shahzad's outside edge.
that's better from Shahzad, riding the bounce on another lifter to push the ball to cover.

and he's off the mark with a crunching stroke through extra cover, off the back foot. No foot movement, but a great connection. It was short and wide, and Jongwe shouted "no, man!" as it whistled away.
straighter, and on a length. Shahzad defends off the back foot.
misdirected down the leg side. Good wheels from the young quick, but the direction is lacking.
and another! This was on the pads and Shahzad just set himself at the crease and flicked it in the air down to long leg. Ten off the first over, Afghanistan off to a flier.
outswinger, on off stump, but Noor Ali turns his wrists over it to find a single in front of mid on. It was a sharp run, but the fielder's shy went wide. Needed a direct hit to trouble the batsman.
doesn't bother keeping it down! Chamu floats an outswinger up outside off, and Shahzad hammers it in the air through extra cover. It went at a catchable height, but in the gap.
another tip and run single, putting the fielder at mid off under pressure.
straightening from a middle stump line, and Noor Ali isn't in quite the right position as he works the ball awkwardly to leg.
pushed down the leg side, the ball flicks the pad and rolls to fine leg. Hunted down by a fielder down there.
Chamu readjusts, hitting a length on off stump to draw the batsman's defence.
on a length, a little wide of off, but the ball is tapped harmlessly to extra cover.
Shahzad is looking in ominous form this morning. This wasn't all that short, but he just stepped back and smeared it in front of square on the leg side.
Panyangara pushes this one up fuller, and it's flicked just to the right of midwicket for a single.
Noor Ali walks down and across to off, but the bowler's line holds firm and he must defend.
definite early outswing from Panyangara, this one curling away outside off. The batsman leaves alone.
a little closer to off stump this time, but Noor Ali raises his arms and ushers it through.
tapped down to backward point.
looped down on off stump, from around the wicket, and the batsman is forward to defend.
after a little look, Shahzad has a go! This was full on offstump, and he cleared the left leg to blast the ball over extra cover.
turn and bounce beats the bat! Masakadza held this one back, floating it down on the breeze, and the batsman was completely done in. But no edge.
a quicker one now, too short on off stump and it's pulled out to the man at cow corner.
Afghanistan are on the charge! Noor Ali spots a short delivery outside off and leathers it through cover point.
well bowled, lifting on off stump. Shahzad hops to defend it back down the track
scything cut from Shahzad, and it bursts through the infield but is hauled in short of the boundary.
on a length, wobbling away from the bat, and Noor Ali shoulders arms.
nicely accurate once more, and the batsman comes half forward to defend to leg.
hooping outswinger, full outside off, and the batsman lets it go again. The seam position must have been close to perfect to get so much movement.
this one hits the seam and comes back in to the bat, hitting the splice as the batsman comes forward in defence.
arm ball, rushing through outside off. It's chopped down to backward point.
much fuller this time, and it's pushed back to the bowler.
punched to extra cover, off the back foot.
well bowled! Shahzad has to hurry his defence as another one drifts on with the arm towards off stump.

Zimbabwe break through! This wasn't the greatest delivery, a touch too short, but it's pulled straight to midwicket. The bowler is a little sheepish in his celebration, knowing it wasn't a good ball, but the fielder flings the ball in the air and roars his celebration.
dot ball to end it, Nabi coming forward to drive to cover.
good delivery, on a length on off stump, and the batsman defends watchfully. Panyangara will have to keep the ball outside off, there's no-one at fine leg.
an angled bat brings a single to third man.
and he's immediately into the action, stopping another attempted glide to third man
consistent bowling, Panyangara sends an outswinger down outside off and it's left alone.
Nabi steps across to push the ball to point.
great over. Panyangara varies his delivery by coming through much closer to the wicket and seaming this one back in, looking for the lbw. But the batsman is equal to it.
classical drive! Noor Ali steps across and leans his arms into a cover drive. High left elbow, all along the ground, and right through the gap.
lift outside off! This one has really taken off. The batsman wanted to cut, but it was too close to him and ballooned over the top edge.
a little straighter, and it's chipped over the infield into the leg side. He's not close to timing it, but there's plenty of space out there.
too straight again, and he's worked into the leg side, along the ground, for one more.
full, outside off, and Nabi angles the ball to third man.
another glide to third man brings one more.
Noor Ali walks right across to the off side to change the angle, and flicks out to long leg.
Nabi checks his drive, and the ball bounces to mid off.
just over the fielder! Nabi came forward to drive, but popped the ball tamely in the air. It hung there and drifted agonizingly close past a diving extra cover fielder. Lucky escape.
good control from the bowler, who is just running in and hitting a length outside off. Left alone.

Noor Ali manufactures a neat little stroke. This was just short of a length, on off stump, but he leaned right back to give himself some room and sliced a cut behind point. Not a lot wrong with the delivery.
Panyangara aims straighter, and the batsman is caught on the crease as he fends one-handed into the leg side. The bottom hand came off the bat handle.
a touch too straight, and the batsman helps himself to a single through square leg.
there's half an appeal for lbw, but this was clearly going down leg. The ball seamed in sharply to beat the bat, but it went too far.
full on off stump, and the bowler stops the return shot in his follow through.

past a diving mid off! Nabi is hitting the ball in the air early on, but he's not quite middling it yet. This was pitched up on off stump, but his airy drive was only a metre or so away from a diving Chigumbura at mid off.
Jongwe pulls his length back a touch, and the batsman defends.
quiet end to the over, the batsman defending to extra cover.
Chisoro comes round the wicket, and the batsman punches to cover.
beaten on the cut, outside off. Quicker one from the bowler.
pitched up on off stump, and the drive goes to the cover fielder.
one handed defence to the off side, seemed there was a little extra bounce.
pushed back to the bowler, the delivery having been flighted down quite slow on middle and off.
flicked on, and the fielder stops it cleanly to complete the maiden. Good start from Chisoro.
round the wicket comes Wellington, and Nabi defends to cover.
beautiful ball! Drifting in, gripping, and spinning past the bat.
pushed to midwicket.
looped down a touch wider of off, and Nabi drives to the cover sweeper.
placed in front of point, and the call for a single comes through straight away.
Nabi jumps down the track to drive, but Sean Williams at extra cover dives to his right to stop the shot cleanly.
on the toes, and it's flicked just wide enough of midwicket to collect a single.
too straight, and Nabi clips through square leg.
well, that's definitely turned extravagantly, but it started too wide of off.
cracked to cover point, off the back foot.
the full length draws the batsman forward, the spin beats his outside edge.
quicker one, and it leaps up at the batsman, he fends to leg, one handed.
nudged off his legs for a single into the leg side.
Noor Ali shimmies down the track and eases the ball to long off.
darted down on off stump, Nabi hangs back to tap to long off.
driven back at the bowler, who gets a palm to it, the ball ricocheting just wide of the non-striker's stumps.
confident use of the feet brings another single, on the drive, to long off.
Noor Ali comes forward to push the ball to Williams at extra cover.

driven back down the ground. The bowler sticks out his boot, but can't stop it, and Tino runs around from straight midwicket. A direct hit at the non striker's end would have been interesting, but his throw misses the mark.
beaten outside off, the batsman attempting to cut.
driven to extra cover, good stop by the fielder.
turn and bounce outside off! The batsman thinks about a cut, but lets it go.
punched to long off, Noor Ali on the back foot.
yet more turn, but it starts too wide of off and goes further.
driven to point.
Nabi comes back and across to defend.
driven down to long on.
punched through extra cover.
past the edge, and the ball rises just over middle stump! Noor Ali backed away to cut, but it was much too close to him.
pushed to cover.
and again, straight to the fielder.
and a third time, Masakadza at cover is right in position to stop the shot in the covers.
beaten! Nabi stepped back and set himself for an expansive pull, but the ball zipped past him. Fortunately for him it was a little wide of off.
flicked off the pads, through square leg.
punched down to long off.
in the air, but landing safely and bouncing down to long off. The ball came off the toe end.
the bottom hand comes in to the stroke to get the ball to long on.
extra cover rushes across, and does well to get a hand on the drive, but can't quite stop it cleanly.
looped down quite slowly, and the batsman nudges gently to midwicket.
well bowled! Williams really got some revs on this. It pitched on leg but was defended on off stump.
nudged just wide of the midwicket fielder.
again midwicket has to rush across, and can't stop the single.
flighted on off stump, driven back to the bowler.
off the inside half of a defensive bat, the ball rolling to square leg to allow a single.
arrowed down well wide of off. A third wide for Chisoro.
quicker one on middle. Nabi reads the length early and picks it up over wide long on, a couple of bounces and it's over the rope. He's been looking for that shot.
sliced out through cover point, and they rush back for the second.
defended back down the track.
Nabi waits on the back foot to defend.
crunched out to the cover sweeper, off the front foot.
Noor Ali comes forward to drive to long on.
turned with the spin to short fine leg.
Raza comes round the wicket, and sends down a flighted delivery on off stump. Defended.
flicked uppishly to midwicket.
tapped back to the bowler.
the batsman stays deep in his crease to work a single into the leg side.
round the wicket, pushed through quicker and it rushes straight on to beat the batsman's cut. Close!
Noor Ali is on the back foot to force the ball down to long on.
pressed into the covers, off the front foot, and Tino runs around to cut it off.
whipped off the pads, the balls rolls out square.
flicked to the right of the man at midwicket, who is very straight. Another single.
well bowled, spinning away from middle and off. Defence keeps it out.
chipped in the air, over a leaping extra cover fielder. Long off runs around to keep them to two.
flicked off the pads, straight to midwicket.
pushed back to the bowler,
the batsman wants to cut, but he's beaten.
sharp single! The ball is angled down to gully, and they must rush through.
off the pads, and he beats square leg for a single
the batsman is forward to drive to long off.
Masakadza sprints and dives at midwicket, but he still can't stop a quick single.
on the drive, down to long on.
Noor Ali comes down the track, and flicks to Masakadza at midwicket.
too short from Williams, and it sits up to be pulled to the wide long on boundary.
pushed back to the bowler, who flings a return at the stumps. It hits Mutumbami's pads and rolls to fine leg ...
pushed back to the bowler, who flings a return at the stumps. It hits Mutumbami's pads and rolls to fine leg ...
looped down on off stump, from around the wicket. Pushed back to the bowler.
flashing drive! But he's missed the ball completely. Mutumbami collects amid oohs and aahs from the field.
nudged to square leg, with the spin.
darted down a little quicker, and the batsman defends.
forward defence, back to the bowler.
flicked into space at midwicket, and the batsmen hustle a single.
flighted up well wide of off, and it's driven out to the sweeper.
a paddle sweep gets the ball to fine leg, but more importantly it's a No Ball.
flung down very fast, but well wide of off stump. Try that again...
and another wide, the ball way outside off.
flapped out to the left of mid on, he's not timed it so it's just a single.
nice flight from the bowler, and it's tapped back to him.
edged! But the ball flies through the vacant slip area and they steal a single as short third man runs in.
a long hop, on middle, is dismissed from Nabi's presence with a pull in the air to deep midwicket.
the ball flies off the edge of a cut and down to third man. Raza is after it, and his right knee looks very stiff indeed. He's clearly still got a problem with it.
full, tapped back to the bowler.
eased down to long on.
the batsman comes down the track and rifles a drive down the ground, Chisoro at long off cuts it off.
pushed back to the bowler off the front foot.
tapped to extra cover.
nice drift, and some spin too. Flicked to the man at square leg.
a touch wide of off, but the cut is stopped at point.
testing line and length, and the batsman is beaten by the outswinger.
floated down on off stump, defended to point.
punched through extra cover, off the back foot.
there's fifty for Noor Ali. His third of the series! He gets there with a nudge in front of square on the leg side.
just short of a good length, on middle, and Nabi stands up tall to get the ball to long on.
pulled behind square, the ball bursting through the square leg fielder's hands, and they take a single as the sweeper runs in.
nice, controlled shot down the ground. He came down the track but didn't over hit it, just chipping it straight.
Noor Ali steps back and pulls to midwicket.

too full for that shot! Again Noor Ali went back in his crease and wanted to pull, but the ball was quick and full, and it zipped under his bat to disturb the stumps. He just misread the length completely. Finally, the breakthrough comes for Zimbabwe!
Stanikzai nurdles into the leg side, not a great deal of movement from his feet.
punched to extra cover, no run.
full outside off, and Nabi gets it out to the cover sweeper.
Stanikzai leans back into an expansive cut, but the ball is bottom edged and bounces to Ervine in the gully.
fuller, straighter and he defends to extra cover.
beaten outside off! The ball wasn't quite there to drive, and it wobbled past the batsman's outside edge.
pushed back to the bowler.
and Chamu keeps it tight on off stump to end the over.
a paddle sweep gets the ball to fine leg, and they sprint back for two.
quicker one from the bowler, and Nabi works it off his hip behind square.
flighted up very high outside off, and Stanikzai is off the mark with a drive to long off.
good awareness from the batsmen, Nabi turning the ball just wide of the midwicket fielder and there's an immediate call for one.
whipped just wide of short fine leg.
punched to extra cover, off the back foot.
boom! Stanikzai smashes a half volley straight back over the bowler's head.
not quite as full from the bowler, and it's defended to extra cover.
past the bat, past the stumps and down to fine leg! The ball stung Mutumbami on the thigh on its way.
sharp single! Masakadza dived at midwicket to stop the shot, pouching it cleanly, but the batsman was safely home by the time he got the throw to the keeper.
punched to extra cover.
tapped to cover point, off the front foot, and there's no space for a single.
beautiful flight, and the ball spins in from outside off. The batsman defends.
aggressive stroke from Nabi, the ball bursts off the inside half of the bat but rolls safely through square leg, and he gets the single to reach fifty.
speared way down the leg side, Mutumbami can't stop it.
turned with the spin to square leg.
now the midwicket fielder stops the shot.
flicked off the pads, into the leg side
he comes down the track, and taps back to the bowler.
driven to extra cover again, on the bounce.
flashing drive from Afghanistan's captain, but it's not timed and goes to mid off.
pushed back down the track for one.
Stanikzai comes forward on the drive, to extra cover.
he comes down the track, and taps back to the bowler.
again Nabi comes down and has a huge swing at the ball, but he inside edges to short fine leg.
biffed down the ground, the ball goes high and lands just inside the rope.
flicked with the spin into the leg side.
driven hard back to the bowler.

caught at backward point! Raza fired this down much quicker, and the batsman came forward to meet it. But the ball bounced more than he was expecting and lobbed off the splice to point, where the fielder tumbled forward to hold the catch. That's the wicket Zimbabwe needed!
nice delivery, right on off stump, and he comes forward to push to point.
Chamu hits a length on offstump, and the ball is tapped to mid off.
nudged just wide of Tino at extra cover, and there's just enough space for a single.
Shenwari comes forward to meet this ball, which is angled slightly to leg, and taps it to long on.

mighty hit into the leg side! Stanikzai had plenty of room to aim for at deep midwicket, with the fielders at deep square and long on, and he held nothing back on the shot. It went really high, and landed right on top of the boundary marker.
Stanikzai comes forward and brings the bat down as late as possible, angling his stroke down to third man to keep the strike.

Stanikzai stays deep in his crease and punches the ball to Raza's left. The bowler rushed around, looking very stiff about the knee, to stop it. I'm not sure how Raza is going to handle quick singles later on.
speared down the leg side once again, and Mutumbami can't stop it even as he whips the gloves across.

great work from the keeper! The batsman aimed a flick-sweep just wide of the fielder at short fine, but the fielder was around in a flash to stop it. It still looked like the single was on, but he rifled a through to the keeper, who caught it cleanly and then turned in a flash to break the stumps right between his own legs - he was in front of them when he caught the ball.
spinning away from the left hander outside off, and he's beaten.
Najibullah comes forward to defend another flighted delivery back to the bowler.
Stanikzai crouches forward to nudge this length delivery to point.
Stanikzai attempts to put the bowler off by jumping across to the off side before the ball is bowled, but Panyangara hits a length outside off and his swipe to leg rills to midwicket.
beaten outside off! Panyangara seemed to really bend his back sending this down, and it burst past the outside edge of a defensive poke.
just short of a good length, on middle, and he pulls out to deep square.
good, sharp running. Najibullah drops the ball down close in on the off side and Stanikzai calls him through.
Stanikzai looks for another quick single into the off side, but Tino is in too quickly from extra cover and there's no chance.
nicely bowled. Dip, grip and spin and the left hander defends awkwardly from the crease.
nothing awkward about this! Najibullah bends down low to hammer a sweep in the air and out behind square.
pushed defensively back to the bowler.
a quicker ball from Raza hurries the batsman's defence!

stumped! Najibullah ran down the track, looking to smite the ball all the way onto 1st Avenue, which runs along the southern side of the ground ... But he ran right past the ball, which spun sharply past him, and Mutumbami had plenty of time to softly displace a single bail from the stumps. Afghanistan lose another, and Zimbabwe are clawing their way back into the game.
make that two more deliveries. This is speared down the leg side, and the batsmen run three more.
flicked to midwicket, and that ends Raza's work with the ball.
chopped down to Ervine in the gully.
rising off a length, on off stump, and the batsman stands at the crease to defend.
another sharp delivery spits off a length and comes off the glove of the batsman, rolling into the leg side.
fuller and straighter, and Stanikzai glances into the leg side for one.
this one hits the seam and comes in to the right hander, who comes half forward to defend to off.
flicked to midwicket, and Tino is quickly in to stop any thoughts of a single.
a touch short outside off, and Stanikzai slaps a cut out to the sweeper.
looped down much more slowly, and the batsman is forward to work a single through cover point.
another flighted delivery is tapped back to the bowler
quicker one, arm ball, and it's squeezed to point.
well bowled, he held it back and the ball spun a little more. Pitching leg, spinning to off, and the batsman defends.
punched to extra cover, the batsman coming forward
on a length, and straight. Pressed back to the bowler.
again Jongwe aims full, and stops the shot in his follow through.
hurled down the leg side, a clear wide.
hurled down the leg side, a clear wide.
seaming in from off stump, and Shafiqullah defends softly to off.
chance for a run out! He tapped the ball just wide of Masakadza at midwicket, and set off ... The fielder had one stump to aim at, but missed. Had he hit, the batsman was a goner.
Jongwe beats the edge once again! He aimed this just short of a length outside off, and the batsman's attempted glide to third man was beaten,
pushed firmly back to the bowler.
flicked off the toes, in front of square.
arrowed down at off stump, and the batsman defends.
a checked drive gets the ball to long off.
pushed through wide of off stump, and it's chopped down to backward point.
beaten outside off! The ball was short and wide, so the cut seemed to be on, but it rushed straight on instead of spinning to beat the bottom edge.
clubbed out into the leg side, but along the ground and straight to the deep midwicket fielder.
Shafiqullah has a huge swing outside off, but misses completely.
this looked like a slower ball, and it beat the outside edge - but unfortunately it's well wide of off stump.
slugged out into the leg side, just the one.
tapped into space between the cover fielders, a quick single.

dropped by the keeper! Shafiqullah swung hard once again, and the top edge ballooned into the air. Mutumbami had to run back quickly, and was slightly distracted by the fielder running in from third man. He wasn't in the right position to take the catch and had to dive - and it ended up just too far from him, bursting out of the fingers of his glove.
flicked off the pads and out into the leg side.
a very quick ball outside off fizzes past the outside edge, the batsman looking to cut.
bowled him! Shafiqullah's feet went nowhere, he just stood in the crease and thrust the bat out at the ball, which drifted in and beat the bat to hit the off stump.

almost a run out! The ball was nudged almost straight at Williams at midwicket. Stanikzai charged out of the blocks at the non-striker's end, and was sent back late. But Williams' throw was really hard, and Masakadza couldn't hold it and knock the stumps down in time. He did well to stop it at all!
he's off the mark by driving the ball to long off.
driven back to the bowler, who collects in his follow through.
left alone outside off, a little inexplicably. Perhaps he thought it was a wide? But the ball landed well within the line.
uppercut up and over point, but without much timing. The ball lands safely and plugs in the outfield.

very full on off stump, and driven back down the track. The bowler sticks out his left boot to stop it. Fancy stuff actually, as he stops the ball with the boot, popping it up and then catching it as if he'd planned the whole thing out just so.
full and wide outside off, and the batsman drives out to the cover sweeper.
Stanikzai's weight is on his back foot even as Jongwe sends one down full outside off, the batsman slapping it hard down to long off.

good catch, on the run! Rashid was aiming straight with this lofted stroke, but couldn't get it quite as straight as he wanted to and Masakadza sprinted around to pouch the catch in front of the sight screen. Afghanistan are squandering what had been a superb first half to their innings.
dug out back to the bowler, who leaps to stop it in his follow through.
full on off, driven to Chigumbura at extra cover.
great diving stop! Again it's Chigumbura, moving very quickly and then diving to stop the ball.
punched back to the bowler.

stumped! Or is he? Well, Umpire Rusere says no from square leg. This looked like a clear dismissal. Masakadza spun the ball past the edge, the batsman falling forward in his defence, and Mutumbami whipped the bails off in a flash, and started running towards the bowler. There's no TV replay, so the umpire must have seen that he got his foot back down in time.
and he rubs it in by cutting the next ball powerfully behind point for four.
tapped softly back to the bowler.

powered away over deep midwicket! Panyangara dug in the bouncer, but Stanikzai saw it early and muscled the pull into the stands. The fielder out there thought he might be in with a chance for a moment, but the ball cleared him with ease.
much fuller from the bowler, and it's dug out to long off.
on a length, on off stump, and Mirwais taps to extra cover.
heaved across the line! This was a slog, pure and simple, but it's effective. Mirwais is a big, strong lad and this pinged out of the middle, flying over midwicket.
now he comes down the track and has a wild swing, but the ball beats the bat.

new ball please! This is absolutely monstrous. Mirwais picked up this length delivery with a mighty hit, the ball scraping the sky and coming down to earth amid the buildings beyond midwicket. That cleared the boundary by twenty metres, easily.
chopped down in front of square on the off side, quick single.
flicked off the pads, into the leg side.
one more, down the ground to long on.

great catch by Raza! Stanikzai jumped down the track and aimed to hit this for six over long on. He got a good connection, but not much height on the shot. Raza ran in a few yards and then tumbled forward, holding it cleanly.
watchful defence, back to the bowler.
whipped into the leg side, they hurry back for the second as deep midwicket runs in.
crunched out to wide long off.
Dawlat walks right across to the off side, and then digs out the yorker towards midwicket.
Mirwais clears his left leg and swings at this, head aimed at the sky. But it's a yorker outside off, and it rushes under the bat.
muscled out to deep midwicket.
Dawlat walks across again, looking for a ramp shot to get the ball over the man at short fine leg, but Jongwe sends down a yorker and the ball zings right between the batsman's legs.
hammered out to wide long off again, and they sprint through for three before Williams can get around from cover sweeper, cut it off, and get the ball back to the keeper.
a low, dipping full toss is swiped down the ground. Wellington Masakadza makes a tumbling stop, running around from long off.
nice yorker, dug out to the left of the bowler. The batsmen chance a single, and Panyangara decides for safety, holding the ball rather than aiming a throw at the stumps.

caught at deep square! The ball was a high full toss, but the umpire confirms it's a legal delivery. Panyangara barely celebrates though. I think he's still vexed after being spanked around in his last over.
pinpoint yorker once again, and the batsman can only dig it out to the leg side.
superb yorker once more. Panyangara is healing his figures just a little. The ball is dug out straight back to him, and the crowd thinks it's a catch, but it's a bump ball.
cheeky! Dawlat Zadran knows it's going to be another yorker, and indeed it is. But he steps forward and jams the bat underneath the ball, ramping it up and over short fine leg for four.

inn2.comm: Chamu is off the mark straight away, whipping a length delivery out to deep square leg for a couple
Mirwais pushes his length closer to the stumps, and Chamu is forward to defend
ell bowled, seaming in off a good length. Chamu meets it with forward defence
too straight, on the pads, and Chamu doesn't bother keeping his flick down, the ball bouncing to the deep square leg boundary for four
pushed too far down the leg side this time, and he's called wide
oh dear, the bowler has lost his radar here. This one shoots way wide of off
much better, full and straight and Chamu's flick goes to midwicket
nudged off the hip, and Chamu keeps strike with a single

got him with his first ball! Dawlat floated a full ball up outside off, and Chamu was much too early into the stroke, popping his drive straight to cover point. It may well have been a slower ball. First strike for Afghanistan!
Ervine is off the mark with a glance to leg. The ball took the inside edge onto the pad, rolling to short fine leg. Dawlat appealed for lbw, but there was clearly a whole lot of bat on that
angling into the thigh pad, and Mutumbami helps the ball on its way through square leg
pitching middle and leg, and Ervine drives back down the ground. Dawlat gets a boot to the ball
a probing delivery, on off stump, is kept out with a solid forward defensive
past the edge! Dawlat angles this length delivery right across the left hander. Ervine comes forward and drives, but the ball shoots past him. Perfect line to the left hander
Mutumbami walks across to the off side to open up a scoring option through midwicket, collecting a single there
appeal for lbw! It looked a touch high, hitting Ervine at the very top of the pad, above the knee roll
full outside off, and it's driven to the extra cover fielder
got him! Angled across the left hander, the ball takes a thin edge and Shahzad holds the catch. Zimbabwe are in early trouble now
great delivery first up. Mirwais get the ball to hit the seam off a good length, completely squaring the left hander up. The ball takes the splice and rolls safely through gully
pushed through full and wide outside off. Mutumbami lets it pass with his hands held high
misdirected down the leg side, adding one to the extras column
much better from the bowler, aiming for the top of off with this one. Williams walks into a forward defence
on a length and nicely straight. Williams defends, and there's plenty of chatter in the field. Afghanistan are buzzing
full and wide outside off. Williams throws his hands through a drive, and the ball flashes down to third man
nice looking shot from Mutumbami. He gets his foot to the pitch and keeps his left elbow high through the drive, but the ball bounces to extra cover

another one falls! Zimbabwe are in all sorts of trouble. Mutumbami advanced down the track and aimed a lofted stroke down the ground. But the ball seamed in sharply, beating his bat and rattling the stumps. Dawlat is ecstatic!
there's plenty of wrist work but not much timing as Mutombodzi comes forward to tap the ball back down the track
Mirwais hits a length on middle and off, and Williams stands at the crease to defend
a touch fuller this time, and Williams is forward in defence
floated up outside off, the ball wobbling through the air on its way down. Someone shouts "catch!" as Williams drives, but the shot is along the ground to extra cover
pushed across the batsman, full and wide, and Williams leaves it alone
punched to extra cover, off the back foot this time
Williams comes forward to drive, and the man at short extra takes some of the sting out of the shot with his palm, but they still collect two runs before the ball is hauled in
Dawlat hits a length on off stump and Mutombodzi defends, on the bounce, to gully
a length delivery shoots through straight, outside off, and is left alone
rising up, just short of a good length outside off. Tino chops the ball down to gully
cracking delivery! This landed full and straight enough to draw the batsman forward, but then jagged sharply away from him to beat the outside edge
Tino leans forward to drive, striking the ball powerfully but straight to the cover fielder. There's some excitement as the fielder throws the ball at the stumps
glanced down very fine. Dawlat pushed this down the leg side, and Tino just had to get some bat on it. Fine leg can't get around in time
Williams comes forward, aiming a neat drive into the covers, where it's stopped by a diving fielder
punched in exactly the same direction, but off the back foot this time
again Williams gets back and across, this time the man at short extra cover jumps up to stop the shot
Mirwais aims a little straighter, and Williams drives to mid on
full and straight again, and Williams pings mid on
thrashed through the gap! The bowler offered width outside off and Williams met the ball with a flowing drive, threading the shot right through the gap. That stroke went straight through extra cover
this looked like the outswinger from Dawlat. But it was wide enough of off stump that Mutombodzi could safely leave it alone
the bowler aims straight, and the batsman comes forward to defend
Mutombodzi taps the ball into the smallest of gaps to the right of mid on, and calls immediately for a quick single
Williams meets a full, swinging delivery with the full face of the bat, the ball rolling to mid on
a touch shorter, on off stump, and it's defended to extra cover off the back foot
punched firmly, on the up. The ball is intercepted at point
tapped down towards the gully. Tino asks about a single, but the point fielder is quickly around
pressed to extra cover, off the back foot.
beaten on the bottom edge! Mutombodzi wanted to pull this one, but it didn't get up quite as high as he was expecting. But the ball rushes through harmlessly outside off
angled down behind square in the off side again, and point sprints across to stop it
offered up to the bat, full and wide, but Tino won't be tempted and leaves alone
left alone once more outside off
Williams immediately charges down the track, punting a full ball to long off for a single
Mutombodzi is alert to the chance for a quick single as he taps the ball softly towards mid off, who is right on the edge of the circle
big slog sweep from Williams, and he's missed the ball completely. But the spin takes it away from off stump
punched to extra cover, off the back foot
high and handsome over long on! Williams comes down the track, gets right to the pitch, and swings cleanly through the line. That's woken the crowd up
tossed up wide outside off stump, but Williams' flashing drive is stopped in the covers
darted at the toes, flicked to midwicket.
pitched up outside off stump, and Mutombodzi's drive is stopped by a diving short extra cover
caught at slip! The ball was pitched up outside off and Tino had a big drive at it. A thick edge flew quickly at Nabi and he held it cleanly
appeal for lbw! This was speared down flat and fast, but it looked as though it was headed down the leg side. Rusere says no
pitched up, outside off, and Raza's drive isn't stopped cleanly at extra cover, allowing him a quick single to get off the mark
flicked off the pads, through square leg for one
Williams leans back to cut, and the shot is cut off at point.
over wide long on! Williams charges out and swipes the ball meatily over the boundary.
punched at extra cover, off the back foot
Williams comes forward to a flighted ball, driving it to the left of extra cover for one
Nabi loops it up outside off, and Raza is down the track to defend to mid off
Raza stays deep in his crease and works a single to long on
full outside off, the batsman comes forward to push it back to the bowler
a wristy drive into the off side is stopped by a diving short extra cover
Hamza aims for middle stump with a full delivery, but Raza is well forward to defend it
cracked into the covers, off the back foot.
quicker one from the bowler, and it's nudged straight back to him.
a solid forward defensive stroke ends the over.
Nabi comes round the wicket to the left hander, and a good length delivery is defended to point.
Williams dances down, but he's not quite to the pitch this time and the ball squirts off the inside half of the bat, rolling to wide long on.
flicked rather more convincingly in the same direction, off the front foot and along the ground
a touch short outside off, and it's thrashed out to the cover sweeper.
fired in at the pads, but Raza's glance goes to the man at short fine leg.
Raza comes well forward to smother an offspinner outside off.
hurled down the leg side, and Umpire Rusere spreads his arms to signal the wide. Up comes the Zimbabwean fifty.
too short outside off, and Williams pulls him out to deep square.
stumped! Raza jumped down the track and wanted to blast him straight down the ground, but he just swung past it. Shahzad whips the bails off, and Zimbabwe stumble even further.
wide of off stump, and it's tapped to point.
edged! But the ball flies low to Nabi's left at slip, and is past him in a flash, rolling down to the fine leg boundary.
oh dear, it's a no ball. Chigumbura nudged it to mid off. He'll do more than nudge the next one, it's a free hit.
fired well wide of off stump. It's so wide that Shahzad can't even stop it, and they run one more as well to put Williams on strike.
well, he's tried the reverse sweep, but he doesn't come close to hitting it. Perhaps tried to hit that one a little too hard.
on a length, defended back to the bowler.
Elton is forward to defend to cover.
punched to point, but the ball meets the fielder.
pushed down the leg side, the ball spinning further to be called wide.
turned with the spin towards square leg.
pressed back to the bowler, who stops it cleanly.
Chigumbura lunges forward to defend.
whipped to leg, though the ball took rather more of the inside edge than Chigumbura was hoping for. Stopped at square leg.
wide of off stump, and it's eased through point for a single.
definite drift in through the air, from around the wicket. The ball is very full, and it's dug out to extra cover.
Chigumbura comes forward to drive, and again extra cover stops it.
chopped right off the stumps and into the covers. Risky stroke.
Chigumbura collects a single with a drive to long on.
off the inside edge! But the ball bounces past the stumps, and Shahzad hurries around to stop it.
Chigumbura skips down to get to the pitch, flicking the ball into the gap at midwicket.
a quicker ball is quickly read and flicked out through deep square leg, off the back foot.
Chigumbura whips across the ball with some flourish, but the ball is stopped at midwicket.
punched back to the bowler.
angled down towards short third man. Chigumbura wants a single, but to his annoyance Williams says no. There did not look like a run there. Or if there was, it was extremely tight.
off the pads, and the man at square leg runs in to field it.
turned with the spin into the leg side.

oh dear, what was Williams thinking here? He came down the track but then chipped the ball very tamely towards long on. The only thing that saved him was the poor connection, otherwise he would have presented an easy catch. He's annoyed with himself.
defended to cover.
again Chigumbura is forward, though this time there was an appeal. I think Afghanistan think it was pad first, then bat. Not given.
nudged carefully to midwicket.
edge, thigh pad and the ball falls just short of slip! Hamza is causing problems for the right handers.
spinning in from off to leg, and Williams steps back to defend.

rifled down the ground. Williams calls for two, but Chigumbura is very leisurely indeed taking the first run, and really has to motor to get home. It should have been an easy, straightforward two. What's going on out there?
slapped hard, but straight to mid off.
big spin from the wrong 'un! I'm not sure if Williams read this, but it was quite short so he had time to withdraw his bat outside off.
defended back to the track.
another wrong 'un, much fuller this time, and Williams does read this one as he comes forward and right behind it in defence.
drilled hard and just to the left of mid on, and they take a single.
very cheeky indeed! Williams stepped way away to leg, and then deliberately dabbed it almost out of the keeper's gloves and down to third man.
Chigumbura comes forward to drive, and hits cover with the shot.
flicked through square leg for one.
Williams gets back and across to defend back to the bowler.
whipped out to deep square leg, and they amble through for a single.
hammered over midwicket! His first delivery was a friendly full too, and Williams absolutely clobbered it over the leg side.
much less flight this time, nudged off the toes.
Williams gets across, right behind the line to defend.
now he's forward to drive to long off.
Chigumbura is forward to defend.
and firm defence ends the over.
spinning in towards the pads, and Williams helps it to short fine leg. Straight at the fielder.
flicked to midwicket.

slashed in front of point, the fielder dives to stop it cleanly. Chigumbura sprints out, looking for a single, and is late being sent back. It doesn't seem like these two are communicating very well in the middle.
Williams presses forward to defend.
flicked through square leg, a single taken.
looped down outside off, and the drive is stopped at extra cover.
swiped out past midwicket, along the ground.
in the air this time, and much more firm! Williams steps out and crunches a full ball over wide long on.
Williams is on the attack, coming down the track, but his drive is stopped at extra cover.
he's on the back foot now, pulling out into the deep for two.
another big one! Williams charges out and picks the ball up sweetly, into the crowd beyond wide long on.
Williams is in an entertaining mood, and now he reverse sweeps, but the shot is stopped at backward point. If he'd got it a metre or two finer, it was four.
too short on off stump, and Chigumbura steps back to collect a single to deep cover.
flicked through square leg.

punched down the ground. There's some argy-bargy between Williams and Shenwari. Williams was standing at the non striker's end and Shenwari barged into him as he tried to get across to stop the ball. Words exchanged
flicked through square leg, one more.
defended back down the track.
a drive rolls down to long off for a single.
a firm drive gets the ball out to the right of the cover sweeper, who has to sprint round. That brings up Zimbabwe's hundred.
placed in the same direction, though more gently for one.
drilled hard down the ground, but long on keeps them to one.
Rashid appeals for lbw as he hits the pad with a googly, but it looked as though Chigumbura was well outside off.

no doubt about this one! A classic legspinner's dismissal. Drift brings the ball in through the air, drawing the bat with it, but the ball then pitches and spins the other way to clip off stump. Superb delivery. Afghanistan strike back!
Chisoro cuts down on a wide one outside off, the ball bouncing to point.
Williams stretches well forward to smother the spin.
swept out hard, and behind square. They rush back for the second.
Williams sweeps over the top of one outside off now, the ball scooting through a little low, but outside off.
tapped square on the off side, into space for the single.
Chisoro comes forward to defend.
again he's forward to meet a flighted offspinner, this time driving into the covers.
Williams leans back and slams a cut out to the cover sweeper. It's to the fielder's right so they take two.
turned with the spin to midwicket.
punched out through cover point for one.
the ball spins sharply in from outside off, and it's punched back to the bowler.
pressed firmly to extra cover, off the front foot.
nicely played, just flicking the ball safely through square leg for one.
Chisoro heaves to leg, but the ball pitches and spins away from him, beating the bat.
nudged to midwicket.
Nabi continues to come round the wicket, and Chisoro chops to point.
chipped up and over the infield, and quite deliberately by the looks of things. Long off runs around the boundary to cut it off.
Williams is solidly behind a flat, fast ball to defend.
flicked through square leg. He's scored a great many singles with that very shot. Worked off the pads.

quick run, and another collision between batsman and fielder! It meant that Williams couldn't get into the crease, but fortunately the throw went wide, as the batsmen had chanced a quick single. That would have been a controversial dismissal, with Rashid getting around and directly into the batsman's path. I don't think it was deliberate.
turned with the spin to square leg
defended back to the bowler.
punched down the ground, another call for a quick single as mid off runs around. He throws at the striker's end, where Williams is headed, and hits the stumps, but the batsman is safe.
a Googly turns and bounces, and is fended back down the track
another googly, this one pitching well outside leg. Williams it hammers out into the deep on the leg side, but straight to the fielder.
Williams works a length delivery off his hip and down to long leg, where two fielders converge. Two runs taken.
punched to point, off the back foot.
uppish! Williams comes forward to drive, and doesn't quite keep the shot down. But it bounces several metres in front of mid off.
nicely placed, well in front of square on the leg side. The ball was full and on his legs.
the ball pings out of the middle of a good looking drive, but he's picked out the cover fielder directly.
Williams is a little squared up as he defends this back to the bowler, the ball just shaping away from him a little ...
it's the wrong 'un but it's very short, and Chisoro can read it off the track, leaning back to pull to midwicket.
Williams gets very deep in the crease to defend.
slammed down to long on for one.
full and wide outside off. Chisoro stretches out to defend.
Chisoro leans out again, but this time with a punchy drive that goes to extra cover.
on the drive once more, but this time he aims for long on.
Chisoro comes half forward to drive to mid off.
very full outside off, and Chisoro digs it out just wide of extra cover.
and angled bat sends a length delivery bouncing towards point.
play and a miss! Dawlat digs this in a little shorter, and it beats the outside edge of Williams' forcing stroke.
dug out to cover point. Chisoro wanders out of his crease and has to scamper back to get safely home. Close!
placed just right, between point and cover, for a quick single.
Williams moves into the 80s with a cracking pull, bisecting the two fielders in the deep. It wasn't all that short, but he seemed to read the length really well.
tossed up a little fuller, and Williams defends back to the bowler.
very full outside off, dug out to extra cover.
Rashid fizzes down a wrong 'un, but it's read from the hand and defended firmly.
tapped to mid off. It looked like a quick single, but Noor Ali ran over it at mid off, and they run another off the misfield.
tapped through square leg, and the batsmen hustle another sharp single.
swept up and over the midwicket fielder in the ring, but he's not got all of it.
nudged to midwicket, no run.
Chisoro comes forward to defend.
Chisoro drives now, to a ball that's full and wide outside off, but it goes to the cover fielder.
whipped out past square leg, and they push hard for the second run.
nudged to midwicket, in defence.
full outside off, and he drives to extra cover.
another drive, this one aimed at mid off. The fielder has to dive, and and there's time for a single.
tapped into the leg side, where there's plenty of room. An easy single.
tapped in front of mid off again. They put the fielder under pressure with the run, and he fumbles.
pitches it up outside off, and Chisoro's drive is stopped at extra cover.
another drive, and again it's aimed at extra cover.
whipped off the pads, and out to deep midwicket.
Chisoro comes down the track and heaves into the leg side, but he doesn't middle the stroke and it's just a single.
Hamza holds this one back, and it spins in sharply from outside off. Williams defends.
turned with the spin, to the right of midwicket. Williams into the 90s.
punched back to the bowler this time

Chisoro perishes! He jumps down the track again, and lofts it straight down long on's throat. Afghanistan inch closer! Somewhat unnecessarily, Shahzad gives Chisoro an extended, loud send off, telling him which way to leave the field.
tapped in front of point, off the front foot, and there's an easy single to be had.
Mirwais targets the pads with a full length delivery, and Jongwe flicks to square leg.
Jongwe is off the mark, nudging the ball down to gully.
Williams keeps putting the mid-off fielder under pressure. He drives a full ball from Mirwais straight at the fielder, and calls for the single. The shy goes wide.
Jongwe has a little fiddle outside off, but the ball buzzes past him and thuds into Shahzad's gloves. The keeper is still up to the stumps.
solidly defended back to the bowler.
flicked with the spin, towards long on.
the ball squirts off the outside half of the drive, rolling gently but into space at cover point.
for the umpteenth time Williams collects a single off his pads, through square leg.
Hamza pitches this one a little short, outside off, and Jongwe leans back to force it away off the back foot.
a careful little drive places the ball just between the cover and mid-off fielders, and a single keeps Williams on strike.
Mirwais floats one down wide of off, and it's eased through the covers off the front foot.
nicely played, a very late cut getting the ball down to third man.
punched to point, the batsman half forward in the stroke.
a low full toss outside off is tapped to extra cover. For a moment the crowd thinks it's out, but it's a bump ball.
this one nips across the left-hander at a testing angle, and he hurriedly defends it off his off stump.
short on off stump, and it's pulled out to deep midwicket for one
tapped down softly in front of point, and Jongwe calls him through for a single.
everse sweep! Jongwe gets it up and over the infield. Three fielders hare after it, and they pull it in just inside the rope. Team effort, one man tapping it back and another throwing it.
watchful defence, the ball falling close on the off side.
Williams moves to 99 with a glance off his legs.
slog sweep! Jongwe moved right across to the off side and then nailed the shot up and over square leg. It bounced just inside the rope.
crunched to extra cover off the back foot, the ball bursting through the fielder's hands to allow a single.
the ball swings in sharply to hit Jongwe's pad, but it was headed down the leg side.
massive swipe across the line! This has swung in again, and it's shaved just past the off stump as Jongwe missed the ball. It's reversing
that's an absolutely outrageous shot! Jongwe reverses his hands and hits this high over third man. He's just reverse swept a quick ball off middle stump.
not this time! Jongwe gets across to the off side and this time he wants to ramp it over the leg side, but the ball beats him and knocks back off stump. Afghanistan close in!
speared down the leg side, a clear wide.
full, swinging and zoning in on off stump. Wellington presents the full face of the bat to dig it out to mid off.
Wellington hops to defend a rising delivery on off stump.
there's the hundred, his first in ODIs! Pushed back down the ground, the bowler can't stop it cleanly and they sprint through for one.
Masakadza comes forward to defend.
that's a good looking sweep from a no. 10, Masakadza powering the ball along the ground to deep midwicket.
Williams charges down and punts a full ball to long on, just the one.
Masakadza heaves across the line, and a top edge loops up and over the wicketkeeper, falling safely.
defended back to the bowler.
dug out just wide of mid off, and they chance a single.
sliced to the left of point. Masakadza charges out, looking for the single, but he's sent back. The throw goes to Dawlat, who drops the ball before he breaks the stumps.
a low full toss dips on off stump, and it's dug out to long off.
stumps destroyed! Dawlat targets the stumps with a full ball, reversing from leg to off, and the middle and off stumps are disturbed. Afghanistan are just a wicket away.
just past the stumps! Dawlat aims for the inswinging yorker, it beats the bat but also - somehow - misses the stumps.
another pinpoint yorker, and Panyangara manages to lay bat on it to dig it out.

game over, Afghanistan win! Williams comes down the track, swings past the ball, and Shahzad breaks the stumps. Shahzad immediately starts pulling stumps out of the ground, tossing one each to the fielders on either side of him and keeping one as a memento for himself. Williams looks shell shocked as he walks off. The crowd stand to applaud him, and he gives them a wave, but there's no smile on his face.
